sens.mc: the person who has the most important role in a play, movie, or TV show
sens.vi: the actor's career has really taken off since he became the lead in that prime-time drama
sens.rel: leading lady, leading man; superstar; ingenue (or ingénue), starlet; star turn [chiefly British]; coprincipal, costar

sens.mc: the space or amount of space between two points, lines, surfaces, or objects
sens.vi: the runner maintained a lead of several meters all the way around the track
sens.syn: lead, length, remove, spacing, spread, stretch, way
sens.rel: altitude, area, breadth, depth, height, rise, space, volume, width; extension, extent; cast, range, reach, scope, shot, sweep, throw; drop, fall, flight, haul; berth, clearance

sens.mc: a piece of advice or useful information especially from an expert
sens.vi: my sister got a lead on the job opening from her neighbor, who is the human resources director for the company
sens.rel: advice, advisement, assistance, counsel, guidance, recommendation, suggestion; caution, cautioning, sign, signal, telltale, tip-off, warning; brief, direction, feedback, instruction, observation; prompt, reminder, urging; answer, clue, solution

sens.mc: a slight or indirect pointing to something (as a solution or explanation)
sens.vi: the police are now working on several leads generated by the evidence gathered at the crime scene
sens.syn: clue, cue, indication, inkling, intimation, lead, suggestion
sens.rel: breath, flicker, glimmer, glimpse, mention, scent, whiff, wind; hunch, idea, inspiration, notion; allusion, implication, inference, innuendo, insinuation; denotation, evidence, guidepost, key, mark, overtone, pointer, sign, signal, telltale, token; assistance, nod, prompt, tip, tip-off, wink; feeling, foreboding, intuition, premonition, presentiment, suspicion; augury, foreshadower, foretaste, harbinger, omen, portent, prefigurement, presage, symptom

sens.mc: to point out the way for (someone) especially from a position in front
sens.vi: an enthusiastic docent led our group through the art museum
sens.syn: conduct, direct, guide, marshal (also marshall), pilot, route, show, steer, usher
sens.rel: precede; accompany, attend, chaperone (or chaperon), convoy, escort, see; control, manage

sens.vi: a senior programmer is leading the team that is developing the new accounting software
sens.rel: control, dominate; direct, govern, handle, manage, oversee, regulate, run, superintend, supervise
sens.near: bow (to), comply (with), defer (to), follow, obey, serve, submit (to), yield (to)

sens.mc: to be at the front of
sens.vi: the local high school's marching band led the parade
sens.rel: precede; announce, herald; accompany, attend, escort, usher
sens.near: conclude, end, finish, stop, terminate; tail, tailgate; dog, follow, trail

sens.mc: to be positioned along a certain course or in a certain direction
sens.vi: this old road leads to an abandoned quarry
sens.syn: bear, extend, go, head, lead, lie
sens.rel: cross, cut, pass; course, follow, span, traverse

sens.mc: to give advice and instruction to (someone) regarding the course or process to be followed
sens.vi: the salesclerk led us through the maze of options now available to television buyers
sens.syn: coach, counsel, lead, mentor, pilot, shepherd, show, tutor
sens.rel: godfather; direct, engineer, steer, sway; accompany, attend, chaperone (or chaperon), convoy, escort, see, squire; oversee, superintend, supervise; drill, train; brief, enlighten, inform; instruct, school, teach, tutor; inculcate, indoctrinate; cultivate, foster, nurture

sens.mc: to take the first step in (a process or course of action)
sens.vi: plans to lead off the news conference with a prepared statement
sens.syn: commence, embark (on or upon), enter (into or upon), fall (to), get off, kick off, launch, lead off, open, start, strike (into)
sens.rel: create, generate, inaugurate, initiate, innovate, invent, originate; adopt, embrace, take on, take up; establish, father, found, institute, organize, pioneer, set up, spawn; get around (to), get down (to), get round (to)
sens.near: cease, desist, discontinue, halt, knock off, lay off, quit, stop; close, complete; abandon, forsake, leave; abolish, demolish, destroy, exterminate, extinguish, phase out

sens.mc: to lead away from a usual or proper course by offering some pleasure or advantage
sens.vi: a con man whose dupes are usually led on by their own greed and eagerness to turn an easy buck
sens.syn: allure, bait, beguile, betray, decoy, entice, lead on, seduce, solicit, tempt
sens.rel: draw in, inveigle, persuade, rope (in), snow; catch, enmesh (also immesh), ensnare, entrap, mesh, snare, tangle, trap; bewitch, captivate, charm, enchant, fascinate, magnetize, wile
sens.near: alert, caution, forewarn, ward (off), warn; drive (away or off), repulse, turn away
